paper_abstract: In this paper, Hoe control problem is discussed for a recently proposed control strategy called the Hadamard synergic control that is achieved via a composite strategy of the state feedback control and the direct regulation of the part of connection coefficients of system state variables. Necessary and sufficient conditions for the existence of such Hoe controllers are parameterized in terms of Bilinear Matrix Inequalities (BMIs). Moreover, some Linear Matrix Inequalities (LMIs) sufficient conditions are also obtained for the problem.
paper_title: GENERAL H-infinity CONTROL FOR HADAMARD SYNERGIC CONTROL: A COMPOSITE CONTROL STRATEGY VIA CONNECTION-REGULATION AND FEEDBACK CONTROL
